Compatability.name: Compatability
Compatability.description: Degree to which a product, system or component can exchange information with other products, systems or components, and or perform its required functions while sharing the same hardware or software environment.

Maintainability.name: Maintainability
Maintainability.description: This characteristic represents the degree of effectiveness and efficiency with which a product or system can be modified to improve it, correct it or adapt it to changes in environment, and in requirements.

Performance Efficiency.name: Performance Efficiency
Performance Efficiency.description: This characteristic represents the performance relative to the amount of resources used under stated conditions.

Portability.name: Portability
Portability.description: Degree of effectiveness and efficiency with which a system, product or component can be transferred from one hardware, software or other operational or usage environment to another.

Reliability.name: Reliability
Reliability.description: Degree to which a system, product or component performs specified functions under specified conditions for a specified period of time.

Security.name: Security
Security.description: Degree to which a product or system protects information and data so that persons or other products or systems have the degree of data access appropriate to their types and levels of authorization.

Usability.name: Usability
Usability.description: Degree to which a product or system can be used by specified users to achieve specified goals with effectiveness, efficiency and satisfaction in a specified context of use.

measure.name: Data Type Integrity Findings
measure.description: The data type integrity property is measured by static analysis tools that can collect findings categorized under source code data type faults.

diagnostics.name: CS0028
diagnostics.description: 'function declaration' has the wrong signature to be an entry point

diagnostics.name: CS0108
diagnostics.description: 'member1' hides inherited member 'member2'. Use the new keyword if hiding was intended.

diagnostics.name: CS0184
diagnostics.description: The given expression is never of the provided ('type') type

diagnostics.name: CS0197
diagnostics.description: Passing 'argument' as ref or out or taking its address may cause a runtime exception because it is a field of a marshal-by-reference class

diagnostics.name: CS0251
diagnostics.description: Indexing an array with a negative index (array indices always start at zero)

diagnostics.name: CS0252
diagnostics.description: Possible unintended reference comparison; to get a value comparison, cast the left hand side to type 'type'

diagnostics.name: CS0253
diagnostics.description: Possible unintended reference comparison; to get a value comparison, cast the right hand side to type 'type'

diagnostics.name: CS0420
diagnostics.description: 'identifier': a reference to a volatile field will not be treated as volatile

diagnostics.name: CS0435
diagnostics.description: The namespace 'namespace' in 'assembly' conflicts with the imported type 'type' in 'assembly'. Using the namespace defined in 'assembly'

diagnostics.name: CS0436
diagnostics.description: The type 'type' in 'assembly' conflicts with the imported type 'type2' in 'assembly'. Using the type defined in 'assembly'.

diagnostics.name: CS0437
diagnostics.description: The type 'type' in 'assembly2' conflicts with the imported namespace 'namespace' in 'fassembly1'. Using the type defined in 'assembly'

diagnostics.name: CS0440
diagnostics.description: Defining an alias named 'global' is ill-advised since 'global::' always references the global namespace and not an alias

diagnostics.name: CS0458
diagnostics.description: The result of the expression is always 'null' of type 'type name'

diagnostics.name: CS0465
diagnostics.description: Introducing a 'Finalize' method can interfere with destructor invocation

diagnostics.name: CS0469
diagnostics.description: The 'goto case' value is not implicitly convertible to type 'type'

diagnostics.name: CS0626
diagnostics.description: Method, operator, or accessor 'method' is marked external and has no attributes on it. A method marked extern should also be marked with an attribute, for example, the DllImport attribute

diagnostics.name: CS0649
diagnostics.description: Field 'field' is never assigned to, and will always have its default value 'value'. The compiler detected an uninitialized private or internal field declaration that is never assigned a value

diagnostics.name: CS0657
diagnostics.description: 'attribute modifier' is not a valid attribute location for this declaration. Valid attribute locations for this declaration are 'locations'. All attributes in this block will be ignored

diagnostics.name: CS0658
diagnostics.description: 'attribute modifier' is not a recognized attribute location. All attributes in this block will be ignored

diagnostics.name: CS0659
diagnostics.description: 'class' overrides Object.Equals(object o) but does not override Object.GetHashCode()

diagnostics.name: CS0660
diagnostics.description: 'class' defines operator == or operator != but does not override Object.Equals(object o)

diagnostics.name: CS0661
diagnostics.description: 'class' defines operator == or operator != but does not override Object.GetHashCode()

diagnostics.name: CS0675
diagnostics.description: Bitwise-or operator used on a sign-extended operand; consider casting to a smaller unsigned type first

diagnostics.name: CS0693
diagnostics.description: Type parameter 'type parameter' has the same name as the type parameter from outer type 'type'

diagnostics.name: CS0824
diagnostics.description: A constructor may be marked as extern. However, the compiler cannot verify that the constructor actually exists

diagnostics.name: CS1690
diagnostics.description: Accessing a member on 'member' may cause a runtime exception because it is a field of a marshal-by-reference class

diagnostics.name: RCS1008
diagnostics.description: Use explicit type instead of 'var' (when the type is not obvious)

diagnostics.name: RCS1009
diagnostics.description: Use explicit type instead of 'var' (foreach variable)

diagnostics.name: RCS1010
diagnostics.description: Use 'var' instead of explicit type (when the type is obvious)

diagnostics.name: RCS1135
diagnostics.description: Declare enum member with zero value (when enum has FlagsAttribute)

diagnostics.name: RCS1177
diagnostics.description: Use 'var' instead of explicit type (in foreach)

diagnostics.name: RCS1210
diagnostics.description: Return Task.FromResult instead of returning null

Data Type Integrity.name: Data Type Integrity
Data Type Integrity.description: Data type integrity refers to the wellness and understandability of data objects. This often involves not using null, returning the correct object in function declarations, and avoiding overridding or hiding other intended data objects.

measure.name: Documentation Findings
measure.description: The documentation property is measured by static analysis tools that can collect findings categorized under source code documentation faults.

diagnostics.name: CS0419
diagnostics.description: Ambiguous reference in cref attribute: 'Method Name1'. Assuming 'Method Name2', but could have also matched other overloads including 'Method Name3'

diagnostics.name: CS0612
diagnostics.description: The class designer marked a member with the Obsolete attribute. This means that the member might not be supported in a future version of the class

diagnostics.name: CS0618
diagnostics.description: A class member was marked with the Obsolete attribute, such that a warning will be issued when the class member is referenced

diagnostics.name: CS1570
diagnostics.description: XML comment on 'construct' has badly formed XML

diagnostics.name: CS1571
diagnostics.description: XML comment on 'construct' has a duplicate param tag for 'parameter'

diagnostics.name: CS1572
diagnostics.description: XML comment on 'construct' has a param tag for 'parameter', but there is no parameter by that name

diagnostics.name: CS1573
diagnostics.description: Parameter 'parameter' has no matching param tag in the XML comment for 'parameter' (but other parameters do)

diagnostics.name: CS1574
diagnostics.description: XML comment on 'construct' has syntactically incorrect cref attribute 'name'

diagnostics.name: CS1580
diagnostics.description: Invalid type for parameter 'parameter number' in XML comment cref attribute

diagnostics.name: CS1581
diagnostics.description: Invalid return type in XML comment cref attribute

diagnostics.name: CS1584
diagnostics.description: XML comment on 'member' has syntactically incorrect cref attribute 'invalid_syntax'

diagnostics.name: CS1587
diagnostics.description: XML comment is not placed on a valid language element

diagnostics.name: CS1589
diagnostics.description: Unable to include XML fragment 'fragment' of file 'file'

diagnostics.name: CS1590
diagnostics.description: Invalid XML include element -- Missing file attribute

diagnostics.name: CS1591
diagnostics.description: Missing XML comment for publicly visible type or member 'Type_or_Member'

diagnostics.name: CS1592
diagnostics.description: Badly formed XML in included comments file

diagnostics.name: RCS1139
diagnostics.description: Add summary element to documentation comment

Documentation.name: Documentation
Documentation.description: The property of source code having to do with documentation.  This does not refer to in-line comments but strictly documentation-intended blocks of code.

measure.name: Encryption Findings
measure.description: The encryption property is measured by static analysis tools that can collect findings categorized under source code encryption faults.

Encryption.name: Encryption
Encryption.description: Refers to elements of code directly relating to encryption, random number generation, password settings, or ciphers and hashes.

measure.name: Exception Handling Findings
measure.description: The exception handling property is measured by static analysis tools that can collect findings categorized under source code exception handling faults.

diagnostics.name: CS0197
diagnostics.description: Passing 'argument' as ref or out or taking its address may cause a runtime exception because it is a field of a marshal-by-reference class

diagnostics.name: CS1058
diagnostics.description: A previous catch clause already catches all exceptions

diagnostics.name: RCS1044
diagnostics.description: Remove original exception from throw statement

diagnostics.name: RCS1075
diagnostics.description: Avoid empty catch clause that catches System.Exception

diagnostics.name: RCS1210
diagnostics.description: Return Task.FromResult instead of returning null

Exception Handling.name: Exception Handling
Exception Handling.description: Exception handling refers to properties in source code relating to exceptions: try, catch, throw statements, exception constructors, exception objects, and program exit or continuation in exceptional situations.

measure.name: Format Findings
measure.description: The format property is measured by static analysis tools that can collect findings categorized under source code format faults.

diagnostics.name: CS0164
diagnostics.description: A label was declared but never used

diagnostics.name: CS0642
diagnostics.description: Possible mistaken empty statement. A semicolon after a conditional statement may cause your code to execute differently than intended

diagnostics.name: CS0811
diagnostics.description: The fully qualified name for 'name' is too long for debug information

diagnostics.name: CS1687
diagnostics.description: Source file has exceeded the limit of 16,707,565 lines representable in the PDB, debug information will be incorrect

diagnostics.name: RCS1001
diagnostics.description: Add braces (when expression spans over multiple lines)

diagnostics.name: RCS1003
diagnostics.description: Add braces to if-else (when expression spans over multiple lines)

diagnostics.name: RCS1006
diagnostics.description: Merge else clause with nested if statement

diagnostics.name: RCS1025
diagnostics.description: Add new line before enum member

diagnostics.name: RCS1027
diagnostics.description: Add new line before embedded statement

diagnostics.name: RCS1028
diagnostics.description: Add new line after switch label

diagnostics.name: RCS1029
diagnostics.description: Format binary operator on next line

diagnostics.name: RCS1030
diagnostics.description: Add empty line after embedded statement

diagnostics.name: RCS1043
diagnostics.description: Remove 'partial' modifier from type with a single part

diagnostics.name: RCS1045
diagnostics.description: Rename private field according to camel case with underscore

diagnostics.name: RCS1046
diagnostics.description: Asynchronous method name should end with 'Async'

diagnostics.name: RCS1047
diagnostics.description: Non-asynchronous method name should not end with 'Async'

diagnostics.name: RCS1050
diagnostics.description: Add argument list to object creation expression

diagnostics.name: RCS1094
diagnostics.description: Declare using directive on top level

diagnostics.name: RCS1215
diagnostics.description: Expression is always equal to true/false

Format.name: Format
Format.description: Format properties refer to how the code is organized from a human-readable stance but not from a semantical point of view.  Format properties directly relate to the understandability characteristic, but can also apply to much more.

measure.name: Functional Syntax Findings
measure.description: The function syntax property is measured by static analysis tools that can collect findings categorized under source code funciton syntax faults.

diagnostics.name: CS0183
diagnostics.description: The given expression is always of the provided ('type') type

diagnostics.name: CS0464
diagnostics.description: Comparing with null of type 'type' always produces 'false'

diagnostics.name: CS0628
diagnostics.description: A sealed class cannot introduce a protected member because no other class will be able to inherit from the sealed class and use the protected member

diagnostics.name: CS0652
diagnostics.description: Comparison to integral constant is useless; the constant is outside the range of type 'type'

diagnostics.name: RCS1048
diagnostics.description: Use lambda expression instead of anonymous method

diagnostics.name: RCS1061
diagnostics.description: Merge if statement with nested if statement

diagnostics.name: RCS1096
diagnostics.description: Use bitwise operation instead of calling 'HasFlag'

diagnostics.name: RCS1156
diagnostics.description: Use string.Length instead of comparison with empty string

diagnostics.name: RCS1165
diagnostics.description: Unconstrained type parameter checked for null

diagnostics.name: RCS1198
diagnostics.description: Avoid unnecessary boxing of value type

diagnostics.name: RCS1206
diagnostics.description: Use conditional access instead of conditional expression

diagnostics.name: RCS1215
diagnostics.description: Expression is always equal to true/false

Functional Syntax.name: Functional Syntax
Functional Syntax.description: Function syntax is the property of source code referring to syntactical differences of functional processes. That is, the use of alternate coding approach to accomplish the same functional goal.

measure.name: Input Output Handling Findings
measure.description: The I/O handling property is measured by static analysis tools that can collect findings categorized under source code I/O handling faults.

diagnostics.name: SCS0030
diagnostics.description: Request validation is enabled only for pages (Configuration File)

Input Output Handling.name: Input Output Handling
Input Output Handling.description: Input and output handling refers to the properties of code involved with the passage of external information to the internal system, or the sending of internal data to external systems.

measure.name: Resource Handling Findings
measure.description: The resource handling property is measured by static analysis tools that can collect findings categorized under source code resource handling faults.

diagnostics.name: CS0728
diagnostics.description: Possibly incorrect assignment to local 'variable' which is the argument to a using or lock statement. The Dispose call or unlocking will happen on the original value of the local

diagnostics.name: RCS1059
diagnostics.description: Avoid locking on publicly accessible instance

diagnostics.name: RCS1210
diagnostics.description: Return Task.FromResult instead of returning null

diagnostics.name: VSTHRD010
diagnostics.description: Invoke single-threaded types on Main thread

diagnostics.name: VSTHRD103
diagnostics.description: Call async methods when in an async method

diagnostics.name: VSTHRD105
diagnostics.description: Avoid method overloads that assume TaskScheduler.Current

diagnostics.name: VSTHRD106
diagnostics.description: Use InvokeAsync to raise async events

diagnostics.name: VSTHRD109
diagnostics.description: Switch instead of assert in async methods

Resource Handling.name: Resource Handling
Resource Handling.description: Resource handling refers to the properties of code relating resource management. Resources can be threads, foreign tasks, events, public instances, and much more.

measure.name: Structure Findings
measure.description: The structure property is measured by static analysis tools that can collect findings categorized under source code structure faults.

diagnostics.name: CS0278
diagnostics.description: 'type' does not implement the 'pattern name' pattern. 'method name' is ambiguous with 'method name'

diagnostics.name: CS0279
diagnostics.description: 'type name' does not implement the 'pattern name' pattern. 'method name' is either static or not public

diagnostics.name: CS0280
diagnostics.description: 'type' does not implement the 'pattern name' pattern. 'method name' has the wrong signature

diagnostics.name: CS0282
diagnostics.description: There is no defined ordering between fields in multiple declarations of partial class or struct 'type'. To specify an ordering, all instance fields must be in the same declaration

diagnostics.name: CS0402
diagnostics.description: 'identifier' : an entry point cannot be generic or in a generic type

diagnostics.name: CS0435
diagnostics.description: The namespace 'namespace' in 'assembly' conflicts with the imported type 'type' in 'assembly'. Using the namespace defined in 'assembly'

diagnostics.name: CS0436
diagnostics.description: The type 'type' in 'assembly' conflicts with the imported type 'type2' in 'assembly'. Using the type defined in 'assembly'.

diagnostics.name: CS0437
diagnostics.description: The type 'type' in 'assembly2' conflicts with the imported namespace 'namespace' in 'fassembly1'. Using the type defined in 'assembly'

diagnostics.name: CS0473
diagnostics.description: Explicit interface implementation 'method name' matches more than one interface member

diagnostics.name: CS0612
diagnostics.description: The class designer marked a member with the Obsolete attribute. This means that the member might not be supported in a future version of the class

diagnostics.name: CS0618
diagnostics.description: A class member was marked with the Obsolete attribute, such that a warning will be issued when the class member is referenced

diagnostics.name: CS0626
diagnostics.description: Method, operator, or accessor 'method' is marked external and has no attributes on it. A method marked extern should also be marked with an attribute, for example, the DllImport attribute

diagnostics.name: CS0628
diagnostics.description: A sealed class cannot introduce a protected member because no other class will be able to inherit from the sealed class and use the protected member

diagnostics.name: CS0659
diagnostics.description: 'class' overrides Object.Equals(object o) but does not override Object.GetHashCode()

diagnostics.name: CS0660
diagnostics.description: 'class' defines operator == or operator != but does not override Object.Equals(object o)

diagnostics.name: CS0661
diagnostics.description: 'class' defines operator == or operator != but does not override Object.GetHashCode()

diagnostics.name: CS0684
diagnostics.description: 'interface' interface marked with 'CoClassAttribute' not marked with 'ComImportAttribute'

diagnostics.name: CS1616
diagnostics.description: Option 'option' overrides attribute 'attribute' given in a source file or added module. This warning occurs if the assembly attributes AssemblyKeyFileAttribute or AssemblyKeyNameAttribute found in source conflict with the -keyfile or -keycontainer command line option or key file name or key container specified in the Project Properties

diagnostics.name: CS1685
diagnostics.description: The predefined type 'System.type name' is defined in multiple assemblies in the global alias; using definition from 'File Name'. This error occurs when a predefined system type such as System.int32 is found in two assemblies. One way this can happen is if you are referencing mscorlib from two different places, such as trying to run the.Net Framework versions 1.0 and 1.1 side-by-side

diagnostics.name: RCS1060
diagnostics.description: Declare each type in separate file

diagnostics.name: RCS1157
diagnostics.description: Composite enum value contains undefined flag

diagnostics.name: RCS1158
diagnostics.description: Static member in generic type should use a type parameter

diagnostics.name: RCS1160
diagnostics.description: Abstract type should not have public constructors

diagnostics.name: RCS1168
diagnostics.description: Parameter name differs from base name

Structure.name: Structure
Structure.description: Structure properites are the elements of source code relating to syntactic and semantic organization of files and objects from the compiler's perspective.
